title: The dark side of Paul Kagame, the Rwandan autocrat who fascinates the West
summary: 'Rwanda Classified.' The president has transformed a country battered by the 1994 genocide. But at what price? Amid repression, surveillance and influence, Rwandans will be voting on July 15 in a presidential election that is a foregone conclusion, with opponents sidelined.

title: 'ChatXiPT, the Chinese artificial intelligence that reflects Xi Jinping Thought'
summary: The technology race launched by China could well come crashing down on the regime's totalitarianism, which bans any content suspected of ideological deviance, writes Beijing correspondent Harold Thibault.

title: Gaza civil defense official says 21 dead in new Israeli strike on Gaza camp
summary: A Palestinian civil defense official told Agence France-Presse (AFP) that 'tents of displaced people' were hit. The Israeli army told the press it had no information on the strike.

title: In Trump's hush money trial, prosecutor and defense give closing arguments
summary: Tuesday, the prosecutor told jurors that the former US president tried to 'hoodwink voters,' while the defense said that he did not commit any crime. The jury is expected to start deliberating on Wednesday.

title: France-Gabon: General Oligui Nguema, a putschist friend in Paris
summary: French authorities, citing the interim president's compliance with the transition timetable, are banking on a rapprochement with Libreville to offset their loss of influence in West Africa.

title: Outrage after racist chants on an island where affluent Germans vacation
summary: The angry reaction to a video showing young people shouting 'Foreigners out!' speaks volumes about tensions in the country.

title: Nearly 10 million Paris region residents are exposed to noise and air pollution exceeding recommendations
summary: The first cross-mapping of noise and air pollution, affecting around 80% of the region's population, greatly surpasses the guidelines of the World Health Organization.

title: The death of journalist John Ntwali in Kigali: an impossible investigation
summary: 'Rwanda Classified.' One of Rwanda's last independent journalists was killed in a road accident in January 2023. In a country that represses media critical of the government, many question the official version.

title: A young Frenchman's nightmarish trip to India
summary: After attending a peaceful Dalit-led march in Gorakhpur, in the state of Uttar Pradesh, a French documentary filmmaker was thrown into prison and then barred from leaving the country for seven months.

title: Georgian parliament overrides presidential veto of the divisive 'foreign influence' bill
summary: The legislature, controlled by the ruling Georgian Dream party, dismissed President Salome Zourabichvili's veto of the legislation that she and other critics say will restrict media freedom and obstruct Georgia's chances of joining the EU.

title: Texas pummeled by storms, over 1 million customers without power
summary: Severe weather, including tornadoes, killed at least 24 people during the Memorial Day holiday weekend in the US. More rough weather and heavy rains were forecast for the Dallas area Tuesday night.

title: From Germany, Macron campaigns against the French far right
summary: The French president took advantage of his state visit to Germany to urge mobilization against the far right. With the European elections less than two weeks away, Marine Le Pen's Rassemblement National is well ahead of the ruling coalition in the polls.

title: 'Emotional' Cornet ends career after record 69th straight Grand Slam
summary: French tennis player Alizé Cornet made her debut at the French Open at age 15. She reached a career-high ranking of 11th in 2009 and enjoyed a surprise run to the 2022 Australian Open quarter-finals

title: Transitional council in Haiti selects new prime minister
summary: Gang violence is still surging in parts of Haiti's capital and beyond as Conille takes over the helm of the troubled Caribbean country awaiting the UN-backed deployment of a police force from Kenya and other countries.

title: Polish foreign minister says it should 'not rule out' sending troops to Ukraine
summary: In an interview, Foreign Minister Radoslaw Sikorski said the country should 'not rule out any option,' a stance he had previously taken in March by supporting 'French President Emmanuel Macron's initiative' to maintain ambiguity on the dispatch of NATO troops.

title: Israel continues striking Rafah, despite outrage over deadly bombing of refugee camp
summary: The UN has called for a 'thorough and transparent' investigation into the Israeli bombing of a camp for internally displaced persons on Sunday, which killed 45 people. Netanyahu described it as a 'tragic accident,' while strikes continued on Tuesday.

title: Macron: Ukraine should be allowed to 'neutralize' Russian military bases
summary: On a state visit to Germany, the French president stressed that 'we should not allow them to touch other targets in Russia, and obviously civilian capacities.'

title: France and Ukraine in talks over sending military instructors
summary: After a discussion between the French and Ukrainian defense ministers, the Ukrainian army's chief of General Staff thanked France for sending him training staff. But later, he said the subject was only under discussion. Paris, meanwhile, did not deny the initial statement.

title: Yahya Sinwar, the elusive Hamas leader
summary: Mastermind of the bloody attack on Israel on October 7, 2023, the 62-year-old continues to evade capture. And yet, the former Palestinian prisoner is leading all negotiations from Gaza, where he is hiding.

title: An Amnesty International report shows executions worldwide last year were the highest since 2015
summary: The report recorded a total of 1,153 executions in 2023, a 30% increase from 2022, and a sharp rise in Iran and across the Middle East.

title: Climate change makes airplane turbulence more frequent and more intense
summary: The sudden air movements, which killed one and injured a hundred passengers on a Singapore Airlines flight on May 21, have increased over the last 40 years.

title: Colombia'congress votes to ban bullfights
summary: Bullfighting originated in the Iberian Peninsula and is still legal in a handful of countries, including Spain, France, Portugal, Peru, Ecuador, and Mexico.

title: Joe Biden: Rebuilder of the US economy or dangerous spendthrift?
summary: With his social, protectionist and reindustrialization measures, the Democratic president has shaken up the American economy.
